"MAD MAX 2 (1981)" + Prince Charles Cinema and drinks
description:
Details on getting tickets + drinks post film drinks below.

PREMISE

Cars, guns, petrol, leathers, desert, mohicans, and Max. According to George Miller — master purveyor of carmaggedon turned pioneer of talking pig movies — this is the extent of what you can expect to find after nuclear war has reduced society to rubble. These are also the magnificent contents of a sequel that betters its predecessor (the shoestring stuntfest/personal revenge movie that was Mad Max) addressing the post-apocalyptic scenario with a punk rock sensibility and creating a grungy future chic and which propeled Mel Gibson to superstardom. And there was, of course, a further sequel, the inferior but interesting Beyond Thunderdome which made the mistake of diluting Max's darkness (concentrating on his journey back to himself).

Obsessed with his furious highspeed demolition derby, Miller structures a very linear plot in Mad Max 2 — you could happily describe it as one long chase scene (but there is a little more than that). Since the events that turned Max Roxatansky, well, mad there has been a total global apocalypse leaving the world stark and empty and startling like the desert badlands of New South Wales. Here a bad gang (led by the towering, bemasked Lord Houmungus (Nilsson) besieges a good gang, led by the idealistic naivete of Papagallo (Michael Preston) who have an oil refinery and therefore the new gold: petrol.

TRAILER
https://youtu.be/UlwtiOyaoo0

CINEMA TICKETS
£14 regular or £11 for PCC members.
Book here for 4.35pm screening: https://princecharlescinema.com/PrinceCharlesCinema.dll/Booking?Booking=TSelectItems.waSelectItemsPrompt.TcsWebMenuItem_0.TcsWebTab_0.TcsPerformance_23565641.TcsSection_18488279

DRINKS
We can go for a drink before the movie.

SCHEDULE
3.00pm - drinks
Film starts at 4:35pm

ADDRESSES
Prince Charles Cinema 7 Leicester Pl, London WC2H 7BY
Read less

name: "HARD TICKET TO HAWAII (1987)" + @ PCC & DRINKS
description:
THE MEET-UP :
We will meet at around 7.30pm for a drink at All Bar One Leicester Square. The table is booked under the name Darren.

TICKETS
£11 Members Ticket
£14 Non- Members Ticket (plus booking fee)
I am in seat A6. You can book your tickets here: https://princecharlescinema.com/PrinceCharlesCinema.dll/WhatsOn?f=22963823

PREMISE
“Look at you two… Every shot, a postcard! I’m gonna give you the best seat in the house!” – Ashley

As much as I enjoyed *Malibu Express*, I assumed all the other movies in Andy Sidaris’ *Triple B Series* would taper off in quality. Well, I’m glad to say that this one is slightly better than its predecessor.

I think a lot of that has to do with this one embracing its comedic elements even more and being pretty over-the-top with the more bonkers shit.

It also helps that this film features Harold Diamond, who was always enjoyable in the movies he did with a similar cult action director, Amir Shervan.

While you could write this off as more of the same, I liked the buddy-action approach, as well as dumping in more Playboy Playmates and sexiness.

That being said, this did look a bit cheaper than the film before it. That doesn’t necessarily make it worse in that regard, it just made it so that the special effects people had to get more creative and they certainly did and succeeded. But you also have to suspend disbelief when the one dude is using a bazooka pretty recklessly but that just makes this picture more fun and absurd, in a great way.

This is absolutely a cheesy action movie but it’s also supposed to be. It felt like Sidaris was self-aware after making just one film and he took advantage of that, giving us a flick that didn’t try to pretend it was something better than it was. It knew its limitations but turned them into amusing strengths. (source https://talkingpulp.com/2020/10/15/film-review-hard-ticket-to-hawaii-1987/)

TRAILER
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UV7h4-2ZUqE

SCHEDULE BREAKDOWN
7.30pm - All Bar One Leicester Square
8.45pm - Film at PCC

ADDRESS AND DETAILS
Prince Charles Cinema, 7 Leicester Pl, London WC2H 7BY

name: I Love Music @The Home Of Music FREE
description:
Exploring the musical archives with captivation at both a very young age and later as a radio (pirate) & club DJ - I discovered only snippets of an estimated 97 million songs even though I went all the way back to the 17th century!

Let's enjoy music, singing, dancing with drinks in hand whilst broadening our music knowledge and exposure by discovering new material, artists and even genres a fun musically themed night out for passionate music lovers only in Camden - the UK home of music.

Contemporary or old - you must be passionate about music which means you will be prepared to talk about your favourite song(s) and or artist(s), influences and the reasons at ease. What is it that makes them stand out and unique? Does the song have personal relevance to you? Are the lyrics poetic or a philosophical masterpiece like in some old hip-hop or is it about the sound of the vocals or hypnotic melodies? Did the song (or artist) play a pivotal role in shaping political change & influence in society (yes some musicians even died for their artform) or the evolution of new music genres, sub cultures and underground music movements today? Was Lennon & McCartney the greatest ever singer song writer combo or have you heard better? Who are the best all time music producers & song writers - Max Martin, Billy Joel, George Martin, Quincy Jones, Bernie Taupin, Dr Dre, Carole King? Did PWL records destroy British music or contribute to it?

We can also touch on influential music producers, labels, DJs and radio stations as well. Discussion on all elements of musicology and enablers is up for grabs!

If you can - come prepared with links to samples (feel free to post youtube and other links in the comments section below) to demonstrate or be willing to sing/rap some lyrics so we can get an idea. Funky dance moves optional.

The event will only go ahead if we have at least 8 people confirmed For drinks I have a limited spaces for 15 so please confirm if you will be joining or not - this will be on first confirmed first come basis.

=========RENDEZVOUS POINT =================
We will meet outside Camden Town Station (Camden High Street exist) and go to my favourite pub in Camden - the very unique Elephants Head with a brillant vibe, very friendly people from all around the world (look out for Johnny Depp, Gaddafi & John Lennon) and music spanning decades from the 50s to contemporary and every style. We iwll be in there all night from the designated start time. Number to be shared on night

I will send out my number to attendees half an hour before the event in case of issues finding us.

Lucas

name: Mystic Fun Social In Park For Deep Minds Pondering The Big Questions
description:
For extraordinary minds with deep hearts possessing an awesome sense of humour, an independent spirit and an unparalleled lifelong adventure quest for the discovery of truth/understanding of how the universe works, our place in it, and exploring the limits of human scientific knowledge using fun constructs.

Yes - join for chilled fun but engaging & thought provoking "sprituality" chatter touching on epistemology, free I Ching readings and a three minute group mindfulness meditation to active gamma brainwaves over coffee/beer! The only differentiated coffee event with mind numbing boring small talk left at home & with Chillout's resident Guru Swami offering free insightful thought provoking readings - just for a bit of fun of course!

If you're intellectually curious, open minded and inquisitive about life's big questions and potential links to noetic sciences & consciousness then is defo for you. We'll try to touch on the empirical literature/evidence for paranormal phenomena & potential explanations including ( I can share research studies with you) :

\- Does life after death exist or is Professor Brian Cox right in asserting if ghosts really existed then particle accelerators at CERN would of already uncovered evidence for ghost particles making Ouija boards kids play?

\- Is synchronicity/coincidence simply randomness disguised in the eye of the beholder? Or can what Einstein famously called “spooky action at a distance" \(quantum entanglement\) and other obsevational phenomena help to explain?

\- What existed before the universe \(big bang\) \- how can you get something from nothing and conversely the reverse? What role does quantum physics play and suggest about unknown dimensions and out understanding of entwined space and time?

"The past, like the future, is indefinite and exists only as a spectrum of possibilities." Stephen Hawking once said. If some forms of matter are not real until they are observed as quantum mechanics repeatedly finds does that mean consciousness not only defines the existence of the universe and perceived reality but also our destiny? Could quantum cosmology then account for what happens to us?

\- Is the near death experieince phenomena millions have experienced a result of neurochemical and hormonal changes that occur in the body & brain close to death \(esp\. in truma conditions\) or something beyond physicality?

\- Given neuroscience research is in it's infancy relative to other areas of medicine/science and so there is yet still so little understanding of the brain\, could mediation help to access additional functions that are not available when we are operate in BAU alpha\, beta and gamma brainwaves phases?

\- As well as the brain \- studies show the heart also contain thousands of neurons\. Does this mean it also plays a role in our consciousness and give credibility to the theme tackled in Last Christmas?

The smartest philsoophers and scientists know we will never know the real truth but can we employ any experimental and other practical empirical techniques to get there? An approach guided by Immanuel Kant's pragamatism & Aristotle's deductive reasoning seems the most optimal epistemology here but is there any other methodologies?

=========RENDEZVOUS POINT =================
We'll meet inside The Zodiac Bar in Camden. I'll send out my number to attendees a couple of hours before the event in case of issues finding the group. I'll be wearing a Starwars identifier and also share table location on the day.

The event is subject to securing at least 10 confirmed RSVPs with 100% intent to attend. In the case of a waiting list - priority will be given to people than can demonstrate a genuine interest in the broader subject area, acquaintances and most loyal members.

Remember our jingo - great stimulating but fun interesting meetups for a great city for free with Chillout London.

Guru Swami Lucas

name: Chillout in Regent's Park with Fun Games (rounders), Chats & Drinks/Food
description:
The afternoon will consist of two phases. Fiirst we'll meet for 90 mins for fun rounders followed by chilled chat, drinks and food in a nearby pretty spot in the park that I'll escort everyone to.

**Part 1 - Rounders**
Rounders is a famous social group sport we (brits) grew up playing at school. Conceptionaly & practically it's very similar to American Baseball & Softball. It's such an enjoyable and fun to play sport that even our unifit teachers took part! name: 🎵 Love 80s Music & Dirty Dancing? Sing Along to your Fav tunes (FREE) 🎶 🍸
description:
Come and have the time of your life by reliving the magical eceletic music era of Madonna, Bon Jovi, Run DMC, Whitney, Technotronic, Debbie Gibson *&* Duran-Wham with opportunity to sing and bust some funky moves like no one's watchin to euphoric bubble gum pop 80s melodies back in Vogue till the early morning light.

The venue will be in trendy but non touristy Islington with a young cool local vibrant crowd (I went to the comprehensive up the road!). Yes apart from me - there'll be no grandads doing the shuffle in here!

Because we love our music - here at Chillout you only get the real deal. Experienced DJs with extensive muisc knowledge and who really know their stuff outside of contemporary pop music scene is very elusive to find. Thankfully this venue's DJ has a wide collection and knows his 80s stuff despite being under the age of 30 - keeping it real all night and taking special music requests as well. **This is not a generic event but a social for people that are passionate about the music, please don't deprive a genuine music lover a place!!!**

If you think those touristy trashy commercial central london places that put on 80s night aimed at generic revellers are any good think again. Many real music fans have complained because less than 20% of tracks played are from the 80s! Sure as a pirate radio & club DJ myself, you mix in some current tunes & remixes to keep things engaging n fresh but this mash up should constitute no more than 5% of what you play on the night.

So unless you want to spend your time in a meat market and want to avoid grave musical disappointment- here's places advertised as retro that best to skip on Sat night:
\- Tattershall Castle 80s Night: Fake\. 10% 80s at best with dance disabled 30 year olds \(i\.e\. 2 left feet\) exhibiting teenage let's get pissed and snog some random on the dance floor mentality\.
\- Loop Bar \- 80s Night: Fake \- Better than Tatters but no less trashy \- filled with tourists & students\. Was better pre\-covid when they had well known experienced former London radio DJs spinning the right tunes
\- Reflex club \- Was the real macoy before recent rebrand into popworld\. Now it's just rowdy plain lame with very little 80s
-Maggie's (Thatcher). Can't fault the music but poncy. Unless you've got a bigger bank account than Rishi Sunnak and you're quintessentially english with a posh accent to boot you'll probably wont get in

So If you know of any venues that don't blatantly violate the Trades Descriptions Act & successfully put on the following nights - message me and we can do some events devoted to music we genuinely love: 50s/Rock N Roll, Hip-Hop (American), 60s, reggae nights, 70s, acid house, 90s, balearic beat/electro, 00s & soul/blues nights.

This is a joint event with another group so actual RSVPs are higher than what you see here.

Lucas - Legendary 80s Hip Hop Grandad

name: Social Drinks @Bank of England For Investors/Entrepreneurs/Economists/Traders
description:
Monthly informal social & networking for us to get know each other over drinks, share some banter and opinions on state of markets & economies and how we should be positioned in terms of short to medium term trades/investments.

Objective here will be to share our thoughts (it's always useful to hear contrarian views and most critically the why) our favourite/most successful indicators & strategies, knowledge acquisition and coming away with some potential trade/investment ideas. But let's not forget this will be a social so we'll have some much needed fun as well!

It will be run in conjunction with my investing strategies group so total RSVPs is higher than what you see here. You can register at following link so stay updated on relevent events and see other RSVPs: https://www.meetup.com/investing-trading-macroeconomics-financial-markets/

**Some potential market impacting themes & latest hot global political & economic developments to ponder:**

1. Central banks tightening and implications for global asset prices (stocks, currencies, crypto, commodities, bond yields, property) and outlook for inflation & economic growth.
2. Current valuations, risk of market crash and prolonged bear market for the major indices. The biggest "everything bubble" since 2000 finally began to unwind Q4 2021 with Nasdax down -30% & some tech stocks down -90%. How more low could we go? A lot lower than people think.
3. My proprietary indicators are forecating a global slowdown in earnings so I see fair value for stocks at much lower mutiples (PE) fulled partly by higher business costs whilst ponzinomics cryptos intrinsic value worth close to zero though - given high volatility - ok for short term trade but watch out below. Japan is now even more fucked with their failed 30 year QE experiment delivering a 50 year low valueless Yen. Is a FX mean reversion trade worth a punt? With the Euro near dollar parity is the failed EU project likely to follow suit soon?
4. Geo political events including but not limited to Russian invasion, financial sanctions and spillovers to global markets and economies.
5. As a US presidential candidate on the campaign trail once mocked the incumbent: "it's the economy - stupid". My leading indicators predicting major contraction if not outright global recession. Apart from the Bank of England, are the ECB/Fed in denial? The 3000+ Phd economists can't all be useless or maybe it's just Jay? Never get a lawyer whose decisions negatively effect billions globally to do a real man's job (what was congress/ president thinking appointing him and for that matter Yellen & Bernanke who have never worked in the real world either).
6. Market Sentiment & Earnings. Spurred by their recency bias, it seems many who never invested in a pre GFC regime have been buying the dips. Beware of the high correlation between growth slowdown & lower company earnings / misses (minus share buybacks). Yes sentiment/investor pyschology can matter short term but profitability ultimately drive prices, even extreme oversold signals on technicals can lose predictive value depending on market regime & levels of risk aversion.
7. Depth of policy tightening & credibility reassertion. Economists pricing in rates to 3.5% along with QT. If inflation persists will a deep global recession be the price we have to pay? Many expect Fed pivot but with inflation forecasts nowhere near target & unemployment well below level considered consisitent with price stability (NAIRU), why would they? This is not 2012 nor 2018 - the only thing that has pivoted is the economic paradigm with nearest parallels - UK/US/Europe in 70s/80s. Asset price mandate doesn't exist, the best empirical evidence shows long term growth suffers and the poor get even poorer. Don't Fight the Fed
8. UK interest rate rises / monetary policy tightening and implications for house prices & economy. Looks like we're heading into recession soon (or already in one). BOE's governer blaming everything from Ukraine to sunspot activity at the annoyance of the MPC hawks!
9. Risks from new Covid variants and macro impact. What's going on with China lockdown of cities like Shanghai? Something not right - ulterior motives to cripple global economy & further add to supply constraints to aid Putin's war? Who knows - as Philosopher Socrates once graciously said "I know nothin". Join the club brethren

Lucas (Macro Economist, Trader/Investor, Strategist, Ex Reuters Correspondent)
**DISCLAIMER- Nothing written here or any views shared at the event should be construed as investment or trading advice**

name: Wine & Stargazing In Park With Telescopes (Confirmed People)
description:
Ever looked up at those twinkles in the night sky and wondered what it's all about - the universe, what's out there, why are we here, where in the cosmos other civilizations might live nearby?

Then RSVP to view the breathtaking rings of Saturn, the expected life harboring moons of Jupiter, the space station fly-by, the Tau Ceti star/system with 2 Earth like planets in the habitable zone that might be harboring advanced life and a range of other fascinating celestial wonderments (star systems, galaxies, asteroids, meteors) over drinks and conversation this June.

I'm able to take a strictly limited number of people (please only RSVP if you can defo make it) to join a friendly informal relaxed local astronomers group I have been a member for over 10 years & their regulars made up of to about 100 people. Also I have people coming from my outdoors activity group here: https://www.meetup.com/londonsocialcruzers/events/284947754/attendees/

You don't need a telescope as you will be able to view through scopes belonging to me and other club members (as long as you behave responsibily and don't temper with equipment worth several thousands). If you have your own telescope feel free to bring it along also and I can help you with setting up if you're a newbie.

In between observing we'll have a drink and having engaging chats on all astronomy related topics for those inclined (astrobiology, SETI/Femi Paradox, astrophysics, cosmology etc.) as well as everyday non space topics and banter. No doubt we'll hear the usual jokes I've heard hundreds of times before!

Alcoholic beverage (wine, beer, cider only), hot drinks and food/snacks will be available to purchase at the observation point/warm indoor cafe with seating area and outside (glass) view of the park.
I will also have people coming from my outdoor adventures group plus some from Calvin's so total RSVPs are higher than what you see here for this reason!

====ITINERARY=====
Meet outside Camden Tube Station at 7.00 PM. After a short wait for anyone delayed, I will escort everyone to the observation point in Regent's Park and brief everyone in terms what to expect and instructions for interacting with any Telescopes. The walk will take 15-20 mins max. Around 10.45 or earlier if the weather turns sour, we will leave and I will walk the group back to Camden. Alternatively people can also take a bus or walk from the observation point to Baker Street. Sometimes a few of us go for a drink in Camden afterwards. I will send out my contact number to people who have reserved for the event in case you have of any issues finding us.
===What Can You Expect To See (this time of year)? =====

* Orion Nebula
* Jupiter and 4 moons
* Star clusters such as The Owl Cluster, pleiades etc
* International Space station fly by
* Saturn & rings
* Venus & Mercury
* Andromedia Galaxy
* Binary & tripple star systems (think planet *Tatooine in* Starwars!),
* Neptune
* Uranuus
* Mars
* Our moon

More here from Jodrell Bank Observatory/Astrophysics Centre:
[http://www.jb.man.ac.uk/astronomy/nightsky/](http://www.jb.man.ac.uk/astronomy/nightsky/)
Guide to viewing the cosmos for beginners:
[https://phys.org/news/2018-05-universe-distant-starstips-cosmology-backyard.html#jCp](https://phys.org/news/2018-05-universe-distant-starstips-cosmology-backyard.html#jCp)
===Weather=====
The event is subject to clear skies on the night so if on the actual day of the event the weather conditions are confirmed unsuitable beyond doubt then I may cancel or postpone. As long as the event is still advertised here, it will be going ahead at designated time!

The event is free but if you would like to make a small contribution to help towards the costs of running of the amateur astronomy club (public liability insurance, fees to Regent's Park etc.) we will be joining then please let me know and I would direct you to the right people.

Happy Stargazing!

Lucas Skywalker (Amateur Astronomer)

name: Mystic Fun Social In Park For Deep Minds Pondering The Big Questions
description:
For extraordinary minds with deep hearts possessing an awesome sense of humour, an independent spirit and an unparalleled lifelong adventure quest for the discovery of truth/understanding of how the universe works, our place in it, and exploring the limits of human scientific knowledge using fun constructs.

Yes - join for chilled fun but engaging & thought provoking "sprituality" chatter, free tarot, I Ching, astrology reading and a three minute group mindfulness meditation over coffee/beer at the uniquie Zodic Bar! The only differentiated coffee event with mind numbing boring small talk left at home & with Chillout's resident Guru Swami offering free insightful thought provoking readings - just for a bit of fun of course!

If you're intellectually curious, open minded and inquisitive about life's big questions and potential links to noetic sciences & consciousness then is defo for you. People with science backgrounds are definitely welcome. We'll also try to touch on the empirical literature/evidence for paranormal phenomena & potential explanations including ( I can share research studies with you) :

\- Does life after death exist or is Professor Brian Cox right in asserting if ghosts really existed then particle accelerators at CERN would of already uncovered evidence for ghost particles making Ouija boards kids play?

\- Is synchronicity/coincidence simply randomness disguised in the eye of the beholder? Or can what Einstein famously called “spooky action at a distance" \(quantum entanglement\) and other obsevational phenomena help to explain?

\- What existed before the universe \- how can you get something from nothing and conversely the reverse? What role does quantum physics play and suggest about unknown dimensions and out understanding of entwined space and time?

"The past, like the future, is indefinite and exists only as a spectrum of possibilities." Stephen Hawking once said. If some forms of matter are not real until they are observed as quantum mechanics repeatedly finds does that mean consciousness not only defines the existence of the universe and perceived reality but also our destiny? Could quantum cosmology then account for what happens to us?

\- Is the near death experieince phenomena millions have experienced a result of neurochemical and hormonal changes that occur in the body & brain close to death \(esp\. in truma conditions\) or something beyond physicality?

\- Given neuroscience research is in it's infancy relative to other areas of medicine/science and so there is yet still so little understanding of the brain\, could mediation help to access additional functions that are not available when we are operate in BAU alpha\, beta and gamma brainwaves phases?

\- As well as the brain \- studies show the heart also contain thousands of neurons\. Does this mean it also plays a role in our consciousness and give credibility to the theme tackled in Last Christmas?

=========RENDEZVOUS POINT =================
We'll meet inside The Zodiac Bar in Camden. I'll send out my number to attendees a couple of hours before the event in case of issues finding the group. I'll be wearing a Starwars identifier and also share table location on the day.

The event is subject to securing at least 10 confirmed RSVPs with 100% intent to attend. In the case of a waiting list - priority will be given to people than can demonstrate a genuine interest in the broader subject area, acquaintances and most loyal members.

Remember our jingo - great stimulating but fun interesting meetups for a great city for free with Chillout London.

Guru Swami Lucas

name: Sunday Sunny Chillout With Fun, Games & Music in Hyde Park, Central London FREE
description:
Chilled Lazy Sunday afternoon relax and fun in sunny Hyde Park to help relieve that hangover from the night before! We'll have drinks, food & range of music to accompany the sunshine plus optionally play some fun neurotransmitter boosting recreational sports/games along the way.

I'll be bringing my beloved Kite, badminton racquets with feather shuttles (I can provide basic coaching for anyone who wants) and maybe my acoustic guitar (unfortunately we won't be able to light a fire and sing songs around it!). Feel free to bring whatever active social hobby you want to share your passion others with. There is a cafe just 5 mins walk away (Serpentine Bar & Kitchen) where you can refuel on drinks, food and snacks. Unless it rains this event will go ahead even with cloudy skies - with the right fun shining personalities around - it can always be sunny!

This is a joint event with Calvin from his group so total RSVPs are higher than what you see here.

**Timings & Intros**
Arrive anytime from between 3.30 to 5 for optimal integration whilst people are still fresh and have not formed inevitable cliques. If you're new to scene don't worry the organisers will be there to welcome and introduce you to other attendees. For easy identification I'll be wearing a starwars lanyard. I'll also share my number here at the start time in case of any issues finding us.

Whoever is left Still Standing like Elton around 7.30ish - we'll go for drinks nearby at the The Back Room pub near Hyde Park Corner (148 Old Park Ln, London W1K 1QY)

I'll be playing sport earlier in the park so if I over run slightly or you can't find me ask for Calvin who is also co-hosting this joint event with his group and he'll intro you to some peeps.

**Where in the park to find us?**
As per the image above we will be in the central london side of Hyde Park very near to the serpentine river and cafe (Serpentine Bar & Kitchen) just 5 mins away and easily accessible via a short walk from Central London stations Marble Arch and Hyde Park Corner. **Exact Location** will be: https://goo.gl/maps/UCpAcWgMPY9A1Rdx7

See you Sunday,

Lucas the hippie badminton & tennis thrashing stargazer

name: REAL LONDONER ENGLISH LANGUAGE PRACTICE IN ALBERT SQUARE WITH JAMAICAN RUM
description:
Alright darlin? How you doin gheezer? Yes born & bred proud workin class Londoner here - innit!!!! Do you want to learn proper London English the way her majesty Liz doesn't speak it? Then tonight is your chance to put on your best London/cockney accent and tune into Eastenders immediately followed by a bit of steamy doctors n nurses action in Holby (ooooh matron).

This will help you interact with real (cockney) Londoners - though I recommemd you watch at least three times a week to attain best results with an optional glass of Jamican rum with Patrick Trueman to expedite the learning process. There will be mutiple teachers at hand to guide you including Phil Mitchell, Martin Fowler, Sharon Watts, Catherine Slater and child twin sister killer bad boy Bobby Bill.

====ITINERARY====
Tune into BBC - no disrespect to ITV - at 19:28 to ensure we catch the intro theme to whistle or sing along "anyone can fall in love" to. Let's hope it ends with an exciting dopamine rush inducing duff duff duff duff duff duff duff, duff at the end.

Note this is neither a meet in person or online event. Instead in line with Chillout's reputation for putting on pioneering world class event exclusives - this first ever TV nationwide meetup hosted in Albert Square so do not turn up to the physical location!!! Please make sure you have paid the license fee or purchased before the airing else I will need to send the boys around in da van.

Just remember what every true East Londoner knows: Every loser wins, once the dream begins. In time you'll see, faith holds the key. And every loser knows, the light the tunnel shows, will shine on you, and all those who knew, that you can make it.

So help keep London English alive before it dies out completely: https://www.mylondon.news/news/east-london-news/cockney-could-wiped-out-20-23010593?

And watch out for my future debut events on how to speak Jordie, Irish, Scottish & Scouse.

Laters,

Lucas Queen Victoria

name: Mystic Zodiac Fun For Deep Minds Pondering The BIG QUESTIONS
description:
For extraordinary minds with deep hearts possessing an awesome sense of humour, independent thinking and an unparalleled lifelong quest for discovery of truth, adventure and understanding of the universe, our place in it & exploring the limits of human scientific knowledge using fun constructs.

Yes - join for chilled fun but engaging & thought provoking "sprituality" chatter, free tarot, I Ching, astrology reading and a three minute group mindfulness meditation over coffee/beer at the uniquie Zodic Bar! The only differentiated coffee event with mind numbing boring small talk left at home & with Chillout's resident Guru Swami offering free insightful thought provoking readings - just for a bit of fun of course!

If you're intellectually curious, open minded and inquisitive about life's big questions and potential links to noetic sciences & consciousness then is defo for you. People with science backgrounds are definitely welcome. We'll also try to touch on the empirical literature/evidence for paranormal phenomena & potential explanations including ( I can share research studies with you) :

\- Does life after death exist or is Professor Brian Cox right in asserting if ghosts really existed then particle accelerators at CERN would of already uncovered evidence for ghost particles making Ouija boards kids play?

\- Is synchronicity/coincidence simply randomness disguised in the eye of the beholder? Or can what Einstein famously called “spooky action at a distance" \(quantum entanglement\) and other obsevational phenomena help to explain?

\- What existed before the universe \- how can you get something from nothing and conversely the reverse? What role does quantum physics play and suggest about unknown dimensions and out understanding of entwined space and time?

"The past, like the future, is indefinite and exists only as a spectrum of possibilities." Stephen Hawking once said. If some forms of matter are not real until they are observed as quantum mechanics repeatedly finds does that mean consciousness not only defines the existence of the universe and perceived reality but also our destiny? Could quantum cosmology then account for what happens to us?

\- Is the near death experieince phenomena millions have experienced a result of neurochemical and hormonal changes that occur in the body & brain close to death \(esp\. in truma conditions\) or something beyond physicality?

\- Given neuroscience research is in it's infancy relative to other areas of medicine/science and so there is yet still so little understanding of the brain\, could mediation help to access additional functions that are not available when we are operate in BAU alpha\, beta and gamma brainwaves phases?

\- As well as the brain \- studies show the heart also contain thousands of neurons\. Does this mean it also plays a role in our consciousness and give credibility to the theme tackled in Last Christmas?

=========RENDEZVOUS POINT =================
We'll meet inside The Zodiac Bar in Camden. I'll send out my number to attendees a couple of hours before the event in case of issues finding the group. I'll be wearing a Starwars identifier and also share table location on the day.

The event is subject to securing at least 10 confirmed RSVPs with 100% intent to attend. In the case of a waiting list - priority will be given to people than can demonstrate a genuine interest in the broader subject area, acquaintances and most loyal members.

Remember our jingo - great stimulating but fun interesting meetups for a great city for free with Chillout London.

Guru Swami Lucas

name: LOVE MUSIC? Sing with live band then DJ / DANCING & more DRINKs (FREE)
description:
If you truely love music then join for drink fuelled fun night of pure indulgent musical fun singing with live band in this neat bar packed with the young trendy urban Islingtoners for a tourist-free musically thrilled night with a difference! After the band finishes around 11, we'll drop some funky moves and singalong to some europhoric tunes spun by a really good verstile DJ mashing up multi decade eclectic tunes verse by verse until 2.30AM in Chillout London style - it's gonna be jam hot!!

Of course you don't actually need to get up on stage and sing - as long as you love music - you are welcome to sing, cheer and dance along with the vibrant crowd.

Note the event date is provisional and may move to Friday 6th May.

\#\#\#\# For The Singers \#\#\#\#
If you've never sung with a real band before and want to sing with the band then make sure you know your song and lyrical placement/timing as this is NOT Karoake or a studio jamming session!

You don't necessarily need vocals like Mariah Carey but you must at least be able to carry a tune or the band will think you're takin the piss! Usually we have two guitarists, a drummer and two backing vocalists. Note that song options are likely to be confined to mainstream soul/blues, pop, rock genres mutiple spanning decades from contemporary to classics so there should be a song for everyone (as long as you don't take one of my songs!)

This is a join event with another group so the number of RSVPs will be higher than what you see here. So limiting RSVPs because the place will be very busy with Islington trendies and so there will be limited slots for songs. The venue will be: Radicals & Victuallers, 59 Upper St, London N1 0NY

Lucas The Entertainer

name: Chilled Out LUNCH Followed by ART Meets POLITICS EXHIBITION in Islington (FREE)
description:
Plenty of chats and playful banter over a lovely relaxing lunch at one of the many highly rated restuarants or pubs on Upper Street located between trendy Highbury and Angel. After lunch, we'll walk to the art and politics exhibition that I've secured tickets for nearby which will appeal to people into art as well government & politics / political science.

The exact cusine will be determined on the day based on demand but could be anything from a traditional pub lunch to Turkish, French, Thai or Italian! Venue will be easily accessible via a short walk from either Highbury & Islington or Angel stations.

We'll meet outside HIghbury & Islington at 1.30 and walk to venue 5 to 10 mins away. For latecomers, I'll update on here once we have a place and also share my mobile number.

Master chef Lucas & your next artful Prime Minister

name: Bollywood Dinner & Music Party in Camden: Drinks, Indian Food & Dancefloor/ DJ
description:
Namesta! Here at Chillout we love trying new things, exploring and experiencing other cultures and tonight is no exception. If you love international music & flavoursome cusine then join for authentic Indian supper followed by a complimentary fun Bollywood music party/club after party and dancing with DJ in the heart of trendy Camden.

As well as traditional much loved classic dishes the restaurant also serves in street-food style sharing plates, paying homage to different regions in India and their trademark street food charms.

\*\*\*\*After Party & Clubbing from 9.45PM
But if you're not into dining/Indian food then you can still join for part 2 of the evening - an euphoric after party from 9.45 onwards in the same venue though you will be charged £10-15 at the door for entry to the club night like all the other punters - a venue specfic charge, nothing to do with Chillout. The music will be a mix of mostly retro and contemporary up-tempo Hindi Bollywood music. Average age in venue is normally between 20 to 40.

\*\*\*\*\*\*IMPORTANT
Unfortunately no plus ones for the dinner (unless you want to book a table for yourself for two or more) as we have limited dining spaces allocated. As this is a very popular venue that gets booked out weeks in advance I have payed a hefty non refundable deposit to book our main table which will then be substracted from the final food/dinner drinks bill for each person. So If you're coming for dinner you need to send me a private message so I can share payment details for pre-booking your place at table (£10 per person). Do NOT turn up for the dinner if I have not booked and paid your deposit in advance. You will be turned away.

Venue wil be shared the day before - it is in Camden town so almost in central london zone 2 with access by buses, underground and overground.

Your Bollywood Singing Dancin Superstar - Lucas Kumar

name: Free - Passionate Music Lovers Unite @The Home Of Music
description:
Exploring the musical archives with captivation at both a very young age and later as radio music DJ - I discovered only snippets of an estimated 97 million songs even though I went all the way back to the 17th century!

Let's enjoy music, singing, dancing with drinks in hand whilst broadening our music knowledge and exposure by discovering new material, artists and even genres a fun musically themed night out for passionate music lovers only in Camden - the UK home of music.

Contemporary or old - you must be passionate about music which means you will be prepared to talk about your favourite song(s) and or artist(s), influences and the reasons at ease. What is it that makes them stand out and unique? Does the song have personal relevance to you? Are the lyrics poetic or a philosophical masterpiece like in some old hip-hop or is it about the sound of the vocals or hypnotic melodies? Did the song (or artist) play a pivotal role in shaping political change & influence in society (yes some musicians even died for their artform) or the evolution of new music genres, sub cultures and underground music movements today? Was Lennon & McCartney the greatest ever singer song writer combo or have you heard better? Who are the best all time music producers & song writers - Max Martin, Billy Joel, George Martin, Quincy Jones, Bernie Taupin, Dr Dre, Carole King? Did PWL records destroy British music or contribute to it?

We can also touch on influential music producers, labels, DJs and radio stations as well. Discussion on all elements of musicology and enablers is up for grabs!

If you can - come prepared with links to samples (feel free to post youtube and other links in the comments section below) to demonstrate or be willing to sing/rap some lyrics so we can get an idea. Funky dance moves optional.

The event will only go ahead if we have at least 8 people confirmed For drinks I have a limited spaces for 15 so please confirm if you will be joining or not - this will be on first confirmed first come basis.

=========RENDEZVOUS POINT =================
We will meet outside Camden Town Station (Camden High Street exist) and go to my favourite pub in Camden - the Elephants Head. We will meet outside Camden Town Station first (Camden High Street exist) and go to my favourite pub in Camden - the very unique Elephants Head with a brillant vibe, very friendly people old and young from all around the world (look out for Johnny Depp, Gaddafi & John Lennon) and music spanning decades from the 50s to contemporary. If you want to singalong with your favourite songs this only you will find it in London.

I will send out my number to attendees half an hour before the event in case of issues finding us.

Lucas

name: Hampstead Heath HIKE/WALK to Parliament Hill Followed by Pub Drinks
description:
Make it a good Friday by joining for a mini fitness walk up Highgate Hill - known to put 20 years olds out of breath - all the way to Hampstead Heath ponds, Parliament Hill and then go for local drinks in Highgate Village or Camden depending on the vibe and where the mood takes us.

This will be run in conjunction with my other group so total RSVPs is more than what you see here (integrated here via my guests counts - for other expected attendee see: https://www.meetup.com/LondonSocialCruzers/events/284794644/)

If you are very unfit or suffer any cardiovascular conditions such as heart disease or severe exercise induced asthma than this walk may not be appropriate for you as we will be walking up a steep hill.

Lucas

name: Social Drinks @Bank of England For Investors/Strategists/Traders/Quants
description:
Monthly social & networking for us to get know each other over drinks, have a bit of banter and share opinions on state of markets & economies and how we should be positioned in terms of short to medium term trades/investments.

Objective here will be to share our thoughts (it's always useful to hear contrarian views and most critically why people think it), acquisition of knowledge and coming away with some potential trade/investment ideas informed through taking a balanced view) but let's not forget this will be a social so we'll have some much needed fun as well!

It will be run in conjunction with my investing & trading group so total RSVPs will be higher than what you see here. Please register at following link if you want stay updated on relevent future events and see the other RSVPs: https://www.meetup.com/investing-trading-macroeconomics-financial-markets/

Some potential market impacting themes & latest hot global developments to ponder:

1. Start of US Fed tightening and implications for global asset prices (stocks, US dollar, crypo, bond yields, property) and outllook for inflation & growth.
2. Current valuations and risk of market crash and or bear market for the major indices (Nasdax already hit bear in March with some junk tech stocks down by 90%), Are we in a bear market rally from the March lows (my view we are) or will we see new highs soon as continuance of existing cyclical bull? The current disconnect between equities and bonds. One is likely wrong - which one?
3. Geo political events including but not limited to Russian invasion, financial sanctions and spillovers to global markets and economies. Also keeping a close eye on the Chinese economy along with the political situation and full lockdowns of major cities (Shanghai). Something does not sound right with this variant. Does the govt have ulterior motives - crippling the the global economy?
4. Depth of Fed tightening policy and credibility. Many economists pricing in at least 6-8 rate hikes along with balance sheet reduction starting May. If inflation persists above target how far will they go before they crash the markets and cause a global recession and unemployment? Because they are so behind the curve - it might be the price they have to pay now to get inflation back under control (nearest parallel here - UK, America and Europe in 70s/80s). Is the current yield curve inversion correct in forecasting a recession or is it a false signal?
5. Market Sentiment & Earnings - seems lots of investors out there with recency bias who have never traded in high inflation regime and thought the Fed will not even raise in March still with buy the dip mentality! Beware Beware. And many don't even seem to comprehend the link between growth slowdown already underway in Europe and US which will drive lower company earnings / misses (not withstanding stock buybacks). Current sentiment based on a range of indicators seems to be out of whack with future fundamentals
6. UK interest rate rises / monetary policy tightening because of high inflation (Dec RPI 7.5%) and implications for house prices & economy
7. Risks from Covid Omicron variant - are will yet to see global economy impact or is it already now largely contained?

Lucas (Macro Economist, Trader/Investor & Ex Reuters Journalist)
DISCLAIMER- Nothing written here or any views shared in person at the meetup event should be construed as investment or trading advice

description:
Bonsour!

Experiencing another country's culture isn't just about learning or talking in another language but embracing all cultural facets. So here are Chillout - as well as the langauge - we love to enjoy associated music, food, cinema, traditions and other cultural elements from around the world to deliver true global authentic experiences right here in London town.

name: Wine & Stargazing In Park With Telescopes FREE (Vetted & Confirmed Attendees)
description:
Ever looked up at those twinkles in the night sky and wondered what it's all about - the universe, what's out there, why are we here, where in the cosmos other civilizations might live nearby? Then RSVP to view the breathtaking rings of Saturn, the expected life harboring moons of Jupiter, the space station fly-by, the Tau Ceti star/system with 2 Earth like planets in the habitable zone that might be harboring advanced life and a range of other fascinating celestial wonderments (star systems, galaxies, asteroids, meteors) over drinks and conversation this Feb.

I'm able to take a strictly limited number of people (please only RSVP if you can defo make it) to join a friendly informal relaxed local astronomers group I have been a member for over 10 years & their regulars made up of to about 100 people. You don't need a telescope as you will be able to view through scopes belonging to me and other club members (as long as you behave responsibily and don't temper with equipment worth several thousands). If you have your own telescope feel free to bring it along also and I can help you with setting up if you're a newbie.

Alcoholic beverage (wine, beer, cider only), hot drinks and food/snacks will be available to purchase at the observation point/warm indoor cafe with seating area and outside (glass) view of the park.

====ITINERARY=====
Meet outside Camden Tube Station at 7.00 PM. After a short wait for anyone delayed, I will escort everyone to the observation point in Regent's Park and brief everyone in terms what to expect and instructions for interacting with any Telescopes. The walk will take 15-20 mins max. Around 10.45 or earlier if the weather turns sour, we will leave and I will walk the group back to Camden. Alternatively people can also take a bus or walk from the observation point to Baker Street. Sometimes a few of us go for a drink in Camden afterwards. I will send out my contact number to people who have reserved for the event in case you have of any issues finding us.

===What Can You Expect To See (this time of year)? =====
- Orion Nebula
- Asteroid 4 (Vesta)
- Comet Neo
- International Space station fly by
- Venus & Mercury early evening post sunset
- Jupiter and 4 moons
- Neptune
- UranUus
- Mars
- Our moon, binary star systems (think Starwars!),
- Andromedia Galaxy, star clusters such as The Owl Cluster

More here from Jodrell Bank Observatory/Astrophysics Centre:
http://www.jb.man.ac.uk/astronomy/nightsky/

Guide to viewing the cosmos for beginners:
https://phys.org/news/2018-05-universe-distant-starstips-cosmology-backyard.html#jCp

=========HEALTH & SAFETY==============
If you feel in any way unwell prior to the event (even if you just have a minor headache, cold/cough, have been sneezing) please do not attend. And please wash your hands thoroughly with soap prior to arrival (before leaving home/office).

===Weather=====
The event is subject to clear skies on the night so if on the actual day of the event the weather conditions are confirmed unsuitable beyond doubt then I may cancel or postpone. As long as the event is still advertised here, it will be going ahead at designated time!

The event is free but if you would like to make a small contribution to help towards the running of the amateur astronomy club we will be joining then please let me know and I would direct you to the right people.

Happy Stargazing!

Lucas Skywalker

name: News Journalism/Writers/Broadcasting Walk/Tour Then Coffee/Drinks (FREE)
description:
If you're a news junkie and passionate about current affairs, journalism, research, writing, broadcasting and related feilds then this is for you! Led by a former professional Fleet Street Journalist and music radio presentator & DJ (me!!!) - we'll tour the natural home of British journalism, television, radio broadcasting and publications since the 16th century and surrounding areas where some of the biggest news stories were broken.

This walk will appeal to people into journalism, books, TV, radio, broadcasting, writers and authors, bloggers, those with an informed passion for global news, politics, economics, media etc.

They say Journalism is a drinker’s game - hence we'll visit some of the most famous pubs (though sadly no drinks) frequented by fellow reporters who interviewed and sourced stories inside off the record! We'll also pass some famous theatres, world famous courts (Royal courts of Justice), the original Bank of England and other landmarks in tha area.

The tour will end with drinks and refreshments between 5 - 5.30pm (where you can also order food) in a surprise venue towards Kings Coss where TV (ITN/Channel 4/Channel 5) journalists still hang out after work to this very day! We might even spot a celebrity newscaster or three.

And oh boy - if I'm feeling musical - I might just sing/whistle that first line that A Day In The Life Beatles song and maybe the rest of it as well.

Actual RSVPs are actually higher than what you see here as I have people attending from my cultural & educational event group.

Correspondent & DJ Lucas (ex Reuters, Groove Radio)

# How/why are we here? Do we live in a simulation like Musk & DeGrasse postulate and if so simulated by whom? Are there multi/parallel universes? Could the multiverse and simulation hypotheses help to explain some (claimed) supernatural & pyschological phenomena?

# Is synchronicity/coincidence simply randomness disguised in the eye of the beholder? Or can what Einstein famously called “spooky action at a distance" (quantum entanglement) and other obsevational phenomena help to explain?

# Does life after death exist or is Professor Brian Cox right in asserting if ghosts really existed then particle accelerators at CERN would of already uncovered evidence for ghost particles making Ouija boards kids play?

# What existed before the universe - how can you get something from nothing and conversely the reverse? What role does quantum physics play?

# "The past, like the future, is indefinite and exists only as a spectrum of possibilities." Stephen Hawking. If some forms of matter are not real until they are observed as quantum mechanics repeatedly finds does that mean consciousness not only defines the existence of the universe and perceived reality but also our destiny? Could quantum cosmology then account for what happens to us?

# As well as the brain - studies show the heart also contain thousands of neurons. Does this mean it also plays a role in our consciousness and give credibility to the theme tackled in the Last Christmas film?

=========RENDEZVOUS POINT & COVID SAFETY =================
We'll meet inside The Tom Cribb in Central London. I'll send out my number to attendees a couple of hours before the event in case of issues finding the group. I'll be wearing a Starwars identifier and also share table location on the day.

The event is subject to securing at least 8 confirmed RSVPs with 100% intent to attend. In the case of a waiting list - priority will be given to people than can demonstrate a genuine interest in the subject area, acquaintances and most loyal members.

Remember our jingo - great fun interesting meetups for a great city for free with Chillout London.

Guru Master Lucas

name: Drinks Social For Traders/Investors/Strategists/Economists/Fund Managers FREE
description:
Monthly social & networking for us to get know each other over drinks, have a bit of banter and share opinions on state of markets & economies and how we should be positioned in terms of short to medium term trades/investments.

Objective here will be to share our thoughts (it's always useful to hear contrarian views and most critically why people think it), acquisition of knowledge and coming away with some potential trade/investment ideas informed through taking a balanced view) but let's not forget this will be a social so we'll have some much needed fun as well!

It will be run in conjunction with my investing & trading group so total RSVPs will be higher than what you see here. Please register at following link if you want stay updated on relevent future events and see the other RSVPs: https://www.meetup.com/investing-trading-macroeconomics-financial-markets/

Some potential themes & latest hot global developments to ponder:

1. Start of US Fed tightening this month and implications for global asset prices (stocks, US dollar, crypo, bond yields, property), inflation outlook & economies.
2. Current valuations and risk of big market crash, a bear market for the major indices (S&P down 12% to date, Nasdax already in bear market with some garbage tech stocks down by 90%!.
3. Geo political events including but not limited to Russian Invasion, financial sanctions and spillovers to global markets and economies
4. Will the Fed tighten significantly or they just telling the mkts what they want to hear? If inflation persists above target how far can they go before they crash the markets and cause a global recession or major slowdown (already underway??)
Lots of investors out there with recency bias who have never traded in high inflation regime and think the Fed will not even raise in March!
5. UK interest rate rises / monetary policy tightening because of high inflation (Dec RPI 7.5%) and implications for house prices & economy
6. Risks from Covid Omicron variant - are will yet to see global economy impact or is it already now largely contained?

Lucas (Macro Economist, Trader/Investor & Ex Reuters Journalist)

name: (FREE) North London DRINKS With Live MUSIC/SING with a Band & DANCING
description:
Join for drinkies, fun socialising, dancing and a night of pure indulgent musical fun singing with live band in this smart but street bar packed with a young trendy urban tourist-free crowd for a musically thrilled night with a difference!

Of course you don't actually need to get up on stage and lead the band - as long as you love music - you are welcome to sing, cheer and dance along with the vibrant crowd. After the band finishes around 11.30, we'll drop some funky moves to a really good DJ mashing up some multi decade eclectic tunes verse by verse until 2.30AM. It's gonna be jam hot!!

You don't need vocals like Sam Cooke but you must at least be able to carry a tune or the band will think you're takin the piss! Usually we have two guitarists, a drummer and two backing vocalists. Note that song options are likely to be confined to mainstream soul/blues, pop, rock genres mutiple spanning decades from contemporary to classics so there should be a song for everyone (as long as you don't take one of my songs!)

Limiting RSVPs because the place will be very busy with Islington trendies and so there will be limited slots for songs.
The venue will be: Radicals & Victuallers, 59 Upper St, London N1 0NY

Lucas The Entertainer

name: Free - Drinks, Dancin & Singing For Passionate Music Lovers @The Home Of Music
description:
Exploring the musical archives with captivation at both a very young age and later as radio music DJ - I discovered only snippets of an estimated 97 million songs even though I went all the way back to the 17th century!

Let's enjoy music, singing, dancing with drinks in hand whilst broadening our music knowledge and exposure by discovering new material, artists and even genres a fun musically themed night out for passionate music lovers only in Camden - the UK home of music.

Contemporary or old - you must be passionate about music which means you will be prepared to talk about your favourite song(s) and or artist(s), influences and the reasons at ease. What is it that makes them stand out and unique? Does the song have personal relevance to you? Are the lyrics poetic or a philosophical masterpiece like in some old hip-hop or is it about the sound of the vocals or hypnotic melodies? Did the song (or artist) play a pivotal role in shaping political change & influence in society (yes some musicians even died for their artform) or the evolution of new music genres, sub cultures and underground music movements today? Was Lennon & McCartney the greatest ever singer song writer combo or have you heard better? Who are the best all time music producers & song writers - Max Martin, Billy Joel, George Martin, Quincy Jones, Bernie Taupin, Dr Dre, Carole King? Did PWL records destroy British music or contribute to it?

We can also touch on influential music producers, labels, DJs and radio stations as well. Discussion on all elements of musicology and enablers is up for grabs!

If you can - come prepared with links to samples (feel free to post youtube and other links in the comments section below) to demonstrate or be willing to sing/rap some lyrics so we can get an idea. Funky dance moves optional.

The event will only go ahead if we have at least 8 people confirmed For drinks I have a limited spaces for 15 so please confirm if you will be joining or not - this will be on first confirmed first come basis.

=========RENDEZVOUS POINT =================
We will meet outside Camden Town Station (Camden High Street exist) and go to my favourite pub in Camden - the very unique Elephants Head with a brillant vibe, very friendly people from all around the world (look out for Johnny Depp, Gaddafi & John Lennon) and music spanning decades from the 50s to contemporary and every style. We iwll be in there all night from the designated start time. Number to be shared on night

I will send out my number to attendees half an hour before the event in case of issues finding us.

Lucas

name: Wine & Stargazing In Park With Telescopes FREE (Vetting & Confirmed Attendees)
description:
Ever looked up at those twinkles in the night sky and wondered what it's all about - the universe, what's out there, why are we here, where in the cosmos other civilizations might live nearby? Then RSVP to view the breathtaking rings of Saturn, the expected life harboring moons of Jupiter, the space station fly-by, the Tau Ceti star/system with 2 Earth like planets in the habitable zone that might be harboring advanced life and a range of other fascinating celestial wonderments (star systems, galaxies, asteroids, meteors) over drinks and conversation this Feb.

I'm able to take a strictly limited number of people (please only RSVP if you can defo make it) to join a friendly informal relaxed local astronomers group I have been a member for over 10 years & their regulars made up of to about 100 people. You don't need a telescope as you will be able to view through scopes belonging to me and other club members (as long as you behave responsibily and don't temper with equipment worth several thousands). If you have your own telescope feel free to bring it along also and I can help you with setting up if you're a newbie.

Alcoholic beverage (wine, beer, cider only), hot drinks and food/snacks will be available to purchase at the observation point/warm indoor cafe with seating area and outside (glass) view of the park.

====ITINERARY=====
Meet outside Camden Tube Station at 7.00 PM. After a short wait for anyone delayed, I will escort everyone to the observation point in Regent's Park and brief everyone in terms what to expect and instructions for interacting with any Telescopes. The walk will take 15-20 mins max. Around 10.45 or earlier if the weather turns sour, we will leave and I will walk the group back to Camden. Alternatively people can also take a bus or walk from the observation point to Baker Street. Sometimes a few of us go for a drink in Camden afterwards. I will send out my contact number to people who have reserved for the event in case you have of any issues finding us.

===What Can You Expect To See (this time of year)? =====
- Orion Nebula
- Asteroid 4 (Vesta)
- Comet Neo
- International Space station fly by
- Venus & Mercury early evening post sunset
- Jupiter and 4 moons
- Neptune
- UranUus
- Mars
- Our moon, binary star systems (think Starwars!),
- Andromedia Galaxy, star clusters such as The Owl Cluster

More here from Jodrell Bank Observatory/Astrophysics Centre:
http://www.jb.man.ac.uk/astronomy/nightsky/

Guide to viewing the cosmos for beginners:
https://phys.org/news/2018-05-universe-distant-starstips-cosmology-backyard.html#jCp

=========HEALTH & SAFETY==============
If you feel in any way unwell prior to the event (even if you just have a minor headache, cold/cough, have been sneezing) please do not attend. And please wash your hands thoroughly with soap prior to arrival (before leaving home/office).

===Weather=====
The event is subject to clear skies on the night so if on the actual day of the event the weather conditions are confirmed unsuitable beyond doubt then I may cancel or postpone. As long as the event is still advertised here, it will be going ahead at designated time!

The event is free but if you would like to make a small contribution to help towards the running of the amateur astronomy club we will be joining then please let me know and I would direct you to the right people.

Happy Stargazing!

Lucas Skywalker

name: 80s & 90s Mascquerade Boat Party With Free Wine/DJ/Dancefloor/Pizza Afterparty
description:
Join for chilled out relaxing drinks & chatter on the Thames Boat followed by a highly frenzied fun night of singalong euphoric 80s & 90s anthems and dance floor hip action in the basement club!

We'll meet, chat & drink for the first couple of hours with conversation friendly background music in the VIP lounge room. There will be over 120 guests as this is a joint event with 5 different groups! I'll be there to greet you individually, introduce you to like minded people to get those engaging conversations & laughs flowing.

xxxx===Ticket Details==xxxx
---You must purchase a ticket in advance at the link below---
Mega Early Bird £5 - Ticket for 1 Person
Early Bird £10 - Ticket for 1 Person
Standard £15 – Ticket for 1 Person
Last Few £25 – Ticket for 1 Person / On the Day
Ticket Link: https://fatso.ma/VuKq

xxxxx==PLAN==xxxxxxx
On arrival from 7.45 onwards, you will be directed downstairs to the main bar where signs will be on display pointing you to the VIP lounge room we have on exclusive hire for you to collect your wristband (for free entry to night club) and receive a free drink if you arrive in the first hour. The free drink will constitute a glass of wine only, no soft drinks and will be served to first 40 people or until we run out.

xxxx==10 PM: 80s & 90s CLUB NIGHT KICKS OFF ==xxxx
At 10pm the main thurst of the night begins with music and dancing in the main club with the DJ playing 80s & 90s dance floor fillers & classics which are back in Vogue with the kids along with 80s denim and leather jackets you see everywhere! You'll be able to request songs as well on the DJ Jukebox. You can also chill and chat in the VIP area or on the roof balcony.

If you're coming alone - best time to arrive would be between 8.30 - 10.00 so I can introduce you to people before the club night begins (it will be loud in there). Please arrive no later then 9.45pm as the venue starts charging @10. There is no refund for this event & no tickets will be sold at the door.

xxxx==2.00 AM OPTIONAL PIZZA DINNER AFTER PARTY==xxxx
For the real hardcore party animals who are Still Standing with Elton at the end, we'll go for freshly made pizza in an Italian resturant to finish off the night and soak up all that booze in nearby Covent Garden where you will also be able to buy more drinks - Salut! Shut Up Your Face? No really it's true but the ticket price does not cover food but 12inch record size pizza are cheap from only seven pounds along with regular priced drinks

So if you love a bit of old skool music & dancing and want to meet some new peeps in the process then come and join the party. I'm really looking forward to the music and bustin some moves - I hope you are too!

Captain Lucas

description:

name: ADVANCED LONDON ENGLISH LANGUAGE PRACTICE WITH EASTENDERS
description:
Alright gheezers and darlins. Listen up - Eastenders I watch all the time, so everybody listen to me funky rhyme. Yes let's put on our best London/cockney accents and tune in to watch enders followed by a bit of steamy doctors n nurses action in Holby City (oh matron) later.

Tune into BBC - no disrespect to ITV - at 19:28 to ensure we catch the theme tune to whistle along or sing "anyone can fall in love" to. Let's hope it ends with an exciting duff duff duff duff duff duff duff, duff as well.

Please make sure you have paid the license fee or purchased before the airing else I will need to send the boys around in da van.

And if your London Cockney English is very poor - don't worry - this will help you improve though I recommemd you tune in at least three times a week. Just remember what every Londoner knows: Every loser wins, once the dream begins. In time you'll see, faith holds the key. And every loser knows, the light the tunnel shows, will shine on you, and all those who knew, that you can make it

Laters,
Lucas Queen Victoria

name: Sunny Walk -Journalism/Writers/Broadcasting Tour Followed By Drinks (FREE)
description:
Led by a former professional Fleet Street Journalist (me!!!) - join for a tour of the natural home of British journalism and publications since the 16th century and surrounding areas where some of the biggest news stories were broken. This walk will appeal to people into journalism, books, TV, radio, broadcasting, writers and authors, print, media, bloggers, research, those with a passion for global news/current affairs and also Lawyers

They say Journalism is a drinker’s game - hence we will visit some of the most famous pubs I and fellow reporters would hang out in & interview sources off the record! We'll also pass some famous theatres, worldwide courts (Royal courts of Justice), the original Bank of England and other landmarks in tha area.

The tour will end with drinks and refreshments around 5pm (where you can also order food) in a surprise venue towards Kings Coss where TV (ITN/Channel 4/Channel 5) & radio journalists still hang out after work to this very day! We might even spot a celebrity newscaster ot two.

Correspondent Lucas

name: Fuck Blue Monday
description:
How are you doin? A few years ago I presented the above slide to a client to push a marketing strategy to make this day more happier for their customers. Urban myth or not - Chillout London is drawing on it's own advice to turn Blue Monday into Happy Monday by offering everyone something fun to do in the same week where we simultaneously freeze in the lowest temperatures of the entire year (northern hemisphere)

- How/why are we here? Do we live in simulation like some great scientific minds postulate and if so simulated by whom? Are there multi/parallel universes? Could the multiverse and simulation hypotheses help to explain some (claimed) supernatural & pyschological phenomena?
Is synchronicity/coincidence simply randomness disguised in the eye of the beholder? Or can what Einstein famously called “spooky action at a distance" (quantum entanglement) and other obsevational phenomena help to explain?
- What existed before the universe - how can you get something from nothing and conversely the reverse? What role does quantum physics play?
- Does life after death exist or is Professor Brian Cox right in postulating that if ghosts really existed then particle accelerators at CERN would of already uncovered evidence?
- If some forms of matter are not real until they are observed as quantum mechanics repeatedly finds does that mean consciousness could define our destiny?
- As well as the brain - studies show the heart also contain thousands of neurons. Does this mean it also plays a role in our consciousness and give credibility to the theme tackled in the Last Christmas film (we love you're music George Michael/Wham)?

=========RENDEZVOUS POINT & COVID SAFETY =================
We will meet outside Kings Cross Station and then walk to the venue 5 mins away. I'll send out my number to attendees a couple of hours before the event in case of issues finding the group.

The event is subject to securing at least six confirmed RSVPs with 100% intent to attend. In the case of a waiting list - priority will be given to people than can demonstrate a genuine interest in the subject area, acquaintances and most loyal members.

If you feel in any way unwell prior to the event please do not attend. And do not shake hands unless you have washed them after arriving. Everyone is encouraged to take on LFT a few hours before.

Remember our jingo - great meetups for a great city for free with Chillout London.

Lucas

name: NYE Party - Champagne Reception, Fun Chats, DJ/Dancing & Roof Terrace
description:
Avoid the tourists & exorbitant drink prices of the West End by joining for an exuberant fun filled night of friendly stimulating chatter, dancing & party antics in professional but young vibrant creative Kings Cross / Islington - the trendiest place in town to see in 2022 with euthoric sounds of the 70s, 80s, 90s & 00s back in vogue! Note this is a ticketed event - please read details fully below.

With exclusive venue hire including a heated roof terrace - the party shenanigans will kick off around 8PM with a champagne reception & snacks (for the first 60 people) where we'll converse and banter for the first couple of hours against a backdrop of chilled hypnotising melodies. Later the DJ will pump up the volume to groove you through to the early morning light with eclectic euphoric singalong & funky party tunes! We're taking no responsibilities for hangovers, sore limbs and recollection of faint but embarrassing memories the day after that will no doubt follow!

=====HOW TO PURCHASE TICKETS=====
Most of my events are free but as the 31st is the busiest night of the year with venues packed out - unfortunately this is a ticketed event. You must purchase ticket in advance else you will be turned away. Please use the following link to secure your place:
https://fatso.ma/VmLP

Mega Early Bird £10 - Ticket for 1 Person / Sold Out
Early Bird £15 - Ticket for 1 Person / Sold Out
Standard £25 - Ticket for 1 Person / Sold Out
Premium/Last Minute £30 - Ticket for 1 Person/ Last Few Remaining

TICKET LINK: https://fatso.ma/VmLP

=====Venue & Plan=====
The new year will unveil at the street trendy but smart - The Fellow in Islington/Kings Cross North London, featuring a bistro bar downstairs, a classy cocktail bar for the more discerning upstairs and a secret heated roof terrace next level up to Chillout - perfect to get in some fresh outdoor air to keep Covid at Bay. If it looks like a clear night, I will bring my telescope so we can do some planet/star gazing from up there!

Note this is a JOIN EVENT run in conjunction with other groups so the number of collective RSVPs/attendees is much higher then what you see on the list. In 2019 we had over 230 people attend. Once the waiting list activates I will weigh priority towards my regular attendees / acquaintances and locals to the venue.

On arrival, tell door security that the reservation is booked under Socialite Connections / Meetup /Michelle. You will be directed to the VIP area where your name will be checked against the guestlist and you will be given a welcome drink (champagne) and a wristband. The welcome drink will only be served to the first 60 people who arrive before 9pm or until we run out.

This event will be fully hosted with very fun socially skilled organisers - including myself - on site to introduce you and ignite stimulating conversations with other like minded professionals. If you're coming on your own it's advised to arrive before 9.30 PM so that intros can be made whilst music is still at low volume.

=== Directions & Ensuring Covid Safe Environment ====
Nearest tube station is Kings Cross Station/St Pancras - 2 mins walk away, Full address: The Fellow, 24 York Way, London, N1 9AA

Please arrive between 8pm- 10pm no later, as it gets very busy and the queue will be long. By 10pm, it will be 1 out / 1 in.

COVID Safe Venue
With a heated terrance rooftop the venue offers covid safe option for those concerned about spread. But everyone needs to do their bit as well. You'll need a covid pass to attend. People will need to use their NHS COVID PASS to gain entry as per the new Government rule. Make sure that you take a screen shot of the QR Code or show proof of a negative result from a recent lateral flow test.
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/nhs-covid-pass#how-to-use-the-nhs-covid-pass-at-venues-events-and-settings-in-england

Vaccainated or not - everyone is encouraged to take a lateral flow test a couple of hours before arrival to reduce spread of virus and protect others.

See you New Years Eve and if not - whatever you end up doing - have a brilliant ecstatic one.

Lucas

name: CHRISTMAS DAY RAVE WITH THREE SHOTS @ Downing Street
description: Xmas day rave @ 10 Downing Street courtesy of the Prime Minister's office. Everyone will be entitled to free tripple shots and that's even before the party has begun - we love you Boris. Now get rest of the fuckin drinks in....

name: Xmas Eve Knees-up, Sinaglong & Dancing (FREE)
description:
All I want for Christmas is....no no please not Mariah again, just simply no Covid restrictions so we can Chillout to a warm fire sipping Pinot Noir just like we did Last Christmas...

You must be fully vaccinated (and have evidence) & present with negative covid test taken today else you will be asked to leave venue.

Join for a classic British festive chinwag, Xmas tunes/dancing and optional chestnuts roasting on open fire. And probably a good old fashioned glittery xmas singalong with the Herald Angels if the drinks flow endlessly which no doubt they will....

Please wear something chrismasie and be up for partaking in some festive singing! Message me with your favourite xmas song so I can add to the DJ playlist for the clubbing phase later in the eve.

This year we'll do the jingle bell rock around the Xmas tree @ the Camden Eye - a cosy traditional boozer 13 secs walk always via the dusty but ponyless road from Camden Tube.

Around the time of the midnight Silent Night mass the club/DJ will get started so if you live in inner North London (zone 2) then this will be ideal for you as you can easily walk home and and don't have to worry about transportation (there is none after midnight)!

Those that came Last Christmas will testify to over 100 attendees so this is destined to be another auspicious Christmas cracker. And I'll personally buy the first larger-shandy for the first person that can correctly guess all of the famous xmas tunes I have referenced above!!!

----Directions & How To Find Us----
Opposite Camden station. I'll be wearing my customary shiny xmas tinsel.

Fully Vaccinated people only. At 11 the venue will turn into a nightclub and everyone will need to show proof of vaccination and or negative covid tests to stay in the venue partying till 3AM.

Santa Lucas

Ho Ho Ho

**This is an acoustic evening to celebrate bringing together people of different walks in life: poets, non-performers, people with things to say; classical musicians, acoustic instrumentalists and singers.**
